p: Foeniculum vulgare Mill. (Fennel) seeds were procured from the local market. The seeds were dried in the shade and stored at room temperature. The dried plant seeds were ground and then extracted with ethanol 70% (60–80°C) for 24 hr using the Soxhlet extraction assembly. After completion of extraction, the solvent was evaporated in a rotary evaporator, and then, the extract was transferred into a clean and dried vial and then stored at 4°C until use (Yazd et al., 2019).
